description: This course develops the knowledge and understanding across inorganic, physical and organic chemistry necessary for advancement to the higher levels of study in pharmacy and dentistry courses. Core topics include: organic structure, function & reactions, polymers & biopolymer, kinetics, self-assembly, metals, alloys and ceramics, solutions, osmosis, acid and base equilibria and biological redox chemistry. This course is recommended for all students in the following programs: B Dental Science and B Pharmacy.
incompatible: CHEM1200 or CHEM1221, CHEM1010, CHEM1020, CHEM1022, CHEM1021
restricted: Restricted to students enrolled in BPharm & BDSc programs.
